se.dat255.bulletinferno.model.physics
Interface Collidable

All Known Subinterfaces:
Obstacle, PhysicsViewportIntersectionListener, PlayerShip, Projectile, Ship
All Known Implementing Classes:
BrutalProjectileImpl, DefaultBossImpl, DefaultEnemyShipImpl, ObstacleImpl, PlayerShipImpl, ProjectileImpl, SimpleBoss, SimpleEnemy, SliceImpl
public interface Collidable

Collision detection event callback for a body in the physics world that can collide.

preCollided/postCollided is called on two objects A, B (you cannot rely on the order) - possibly multiple times - if an object might have collided. "Might have collided" means that if some object in its collision handler removes a body from the world (which is OK to do), that body might still get several collision event callback calls. Also, there is no way to stop this process. The advice is that implementations keep track of this internally.

Method Summary
 void postCollided(Collidable other)
          Called after preCollided for each collision pair (can be called multiple times).
 void preCollided(Collidable other)
          Called before postCollided for each collision pair (can be called multiple times).
 

Method Detail

preCollided

void preCollided(Collidable other)
Called before postCollided for each collision pair (can be called multiple times). Please see the documentation for Collidable for caveats about this process!

Useful for getting information from another body (e.g. decrease health if other not dead).

Parameters:
other - the object that a collision (might) have occured with.

postCollided

void postCollided(Collidable other)
Called after preCollided for each collision pair (can be called multiple times). Please see the documentation for Collidable for caveats about this process!

Useful for setting properties on this object (e.g. set dead flag).

Parameters:
other - the object that a collision (might) have occured with.
